channel.title: q-fin.CP updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: q-fin.CP updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Governance, productivity and economic development
item.description: arXiv:2507.13099v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: This paper explores the interplay between transfer policies, R\&D, corruption, and economic development using a general equilibrium model with heterogeneous agents and a government. The government collects taxes, redistributes fiscal revenues, and undertakes public investment (in R\&D, infrastructure, etc.). Corruption is modeled as a fraction of tax revenues that is siphoned off and removed from the economy. We first establish the existence of a political-economic equilibrium. Then, using an analytically tractable framework with two private agents, we examine the effects of corruption and evaluate the impact of various policies, including redistribution and innovation-led strategies.
item.dc:creator: Cuong Le Van (CNRS, PSE, CES), Ngoc-Sang Pham (EM Normandie), Thi Kim Cuong Pham (EconomiX), Binh Tran-Nam (RMIT)

item.title: NUFFT for the Fast COS Method
item.description: arXiv:2507.13186v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: The COS method is a very efficient way to compute European option prices under L\'evy models or affine stochastic volatility models, based on a Fourier Cosine expansion of the density, involving the characteristic function. This note shows how to compute the COS method formula with a non-uniform fast Fourier transform, thus allowing to price many options of the same maturity but different strikes at an unprecedented speed.
item.dc:creator: Fabien LeFloc'h
